user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_finish_threads:
```c
void metal_finish_threads(int threads, void *tids)
{
	int i;
	pthread_t *tid_p = (pthread_t *)tids;

	if (!tids) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "invalid argument, tids is NULL.\n");
		return;
	}

	for (i = 0; i < threads; i++)
		(void)pthread_join(tid_p[i], NULL);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_finish_threads:
static int condition(void)
{
	int ret;
	int ts_created;
	pthread_t tids[THREADS];

	/** TC1 consumer threads go first */
	/** create 10 consumer threads first */
	ret = metal_run_noblock(THREADS, consumer_thread, NULL, tids,
				&ts_created);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create consumer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

	/** create 10 producer threads next */
	ret = metal_run(THREADS, producer_thread, NULL);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create producer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

	/** wait for consumer threads to finish */
	metal_finish_threads(THREADS, (void *)tids);

	/** TC2 producer threads go first */
	/** create 10 producer threads first */
	ret = metal_run_noblock(THREADS, producer_thread, NULL, tids,
				&ts_created);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create consumer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

	/** create 10 consumer threads next */
	ret = metal_run(THREADS, consumer_thread, NULL);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create producer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

out:
	/** wait for producer threads to finish */
	metal_finish_threads(THREADS, (void *)tids);
	return ret;
}
...
int metal_run(int threads, metal_thread_t child, void *arg)
{
	pthread_t tids[threads];
	int error, ts_created;

	error = metal_run_noblock(threads, child, arg, tids, &ts_created);

	metal_finish_threads(ts_created, (void *)tids);

	return error;
}
...
#define metal_log(level, fmt, __VA_ARGS__) ({if(_metal.common.log_handler&&level<=_metal.common.log_level)_metal.common.log_handler(level,metal_fmt(fmt),##__VA_ARGS__);\
})
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No calls to any of the <string.h> functions listed in MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 (memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, strspn, etc.) are present in the provided fragments. The function metal_finish_threads only casts a void* to pthread_t* and calls pthread_join; this does not involve string handling and therefore is not relevant to Rule 21.17. The helper functions shown (metal_run, condition) allocate and pass pthread_t arrays and call metal_finish_threads but contain no string.h usage. The macro metal_log and the symbol metal_fmt(fmt) are referenced but their implementations are not provided; since no string.h functions are visible in the supplied code, they cannot be flagged here. If metal_fmt or the log handler use any of the listed string functions, those implementations should be inspected separately, but they are not part of the provided code and so are not included as suspicious fragments for Rule 21.17.
